TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit SamlConstants extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a set of constants that are used to set properties of a security token. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the SamlConstants class to set properties of a SAML assertion. Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.EmailNamespace%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.UserNameNamespace%2A> properties to set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameFormat%2A> property. Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.HolderOfKey%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.SenderVouches%2A> to set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.ConfirmationMethods%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the attribute used to specify that the subject of a SAML assertion is specified as an e-mail address. This field is constant.
Docs.value: The name of the attribute used to specify that the subject of a SAML assertion is specified as an e-mail address. This field is constant.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the EmailName property when serializing SAML assertions.

Docs.summary: Gets a URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified as an e-mail address. This field is constant.
Docs.value: A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified as an e-mail address.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the EmailNamespace property to set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameFormat%2A> property when the subject is specified as an e-mail address.

Docs.summary: Gets a URI that specifies that the recipient of a SAML security token should use the element to confirm that the SOAP message was sent by the SAML assertion's subject. This field is constant.
Docs.value: A URI that specifies that the recipient of a security token should use the element to confirm that the SOAP message was sent by the SAML assertion's subject.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the HolderOfKey property to set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.ConfirmationMethods%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets the major version of the SAML specification that security tokens conform to. This field is constant.
Docs.value: The major version of the SAML specification that security tokens conform to. Always `1`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The combination of the MajorVersionValue and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.MinorVersionValue%2A> properties comprises the version of the SAML specification that <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens conform to.

Docs.summary: Gets the minor version of the SAML specification used by security tokens. This field is constant.
Docs.value:
The minor version of the SAML specification. Always `1`.
The combination of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.MajorVersionValue%2A> and MinorVersionValue properties comprises the version of the SAML specification that security tokens conform to.

Docs.summary: Gets the XML namespace in which SAML assertions are defined. This field is constant.
Docs.value: The XML namespace in which SAML assertions are defined.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The XML namespace is defined in the version of the SAML specification specified by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.MajorVersionValue%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.MinorVersionValue%2A> properties.

Docs.summary: The SAML namespace prefix. This field is constant.

Gets a URI that specifies that additional information is not available for a recipient of a SAML security token to confirm that the SOAP message was sent by the SAML assertion's subject. This field is constant.
Docs.value: A URI that specifies that additional information is not available for a recipient of a SAML security token to confirm that the SOAP message was sent by the SAML assertion's subject.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the SenderVouches property to set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.ConfirmationMethods%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the attribute used to specify that the subject of a SAML assertion is specified as a Windows domain account. This field is constant.
Docs.value: The name of the attribute used to specify that the subject of a SAML assertion is specified as a Windows domain account. This field is constant.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the UserName property when serializing SAML assertions.

Docs.summary: Gets a URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified using a Windows domain account. This field is constant.
Docs.value: A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified using a Windows domain account.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the UserNameNamespace property to set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameFormat%2A> property when the subject is specified as a Windows domain account.
